channel.title: Metrics on search bar
channel.description:
Hi Caue,
I have a question for you- a client would like a search bar added to their website. However, the client wants the search bar to be able to collect the search terms that people search for so that he can look at those results and analyze them to see if he is offering the right products.
Is this possible? Could you do this?
Thanks! Kate

item.title: Metrics on search bar
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

That's awesome!

Read full topic

item.title: Metrics on search bar
item.dc:creator: @Kate Kate
item.description:
@Kate wrote:

I actually just found out that this is included in Squarespace- when you click on metrics in the CMS, you can then click on website aeries and see the ones that were typed into your search bar!

Read full topic

item.title: Metrics on search bar
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

I think squarespace metrics would not do that, but it sure can be done using google anayltics, specially if we use google's search bar: https://support.google.com/customsearch/answer/2715510?hl=en

So yeah, quite possible to do. I can only promise anything done after April 30th, though.

Read full topic
